alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 2:32PM MST until July 31 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Arizona and southwest Arizona, including the following counties, in south central Arizona, Maricopa. In southwest Arizona, Yuma. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gila Bend, Sentinel, Dateland, Mohawk and Kaka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
